channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Takeaways from Trump's address. And, some GOP lawmakers shift stance on ACA subsidies
item.description: During a nationwide address, President Trump says the U.S. is poised for an economic boom. And, some Republican lawmakers joined Democrats to force a ...

item.title: RFK Jr. and Dr. Oz to announce moves to ban gender-affirming care for young people
item.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is expected to announce a package of measures that would together ban gender-affirming care for minors. A press...

item.title: A new 'Avatar,' a marital stand-up story and a gut-wrenching drama are in theaters
item.description: A new drama uses the real, gut-wrenching recordings of a call for help from Gaza to tell a harrowing and profound story.

item.title: New York has a new Archbishop. His background looks a lot like Pope Leo's
item.description: Like Pope Leo, Bishop Ronald Hicks is an Illinois native with deep experience in Latin America.

item.title: Could international troops be sent to Gaza? Here's why Trump's plan hinges on it
item.description: President Trump's peace plan for Gaza hinges on international troops in Gaza, but Israel is skeptical and no country has yet agreed to send their sold...

item.title: An early look at our town hall and debate series, launching in 2026
item.description: "Things That Matter," a series of planned town halls and debates sponsored by Bank of America, will launch early next year.

item.title: Rebels start to withdraw from key DR Congo city, leaders say
item.description: DR Congo's government say the announced withdrawal is intended to distract the US mediation team.

item.title: Pope Leo taps Bishop Ronald Hicks to succeed Cardinal Dolan
item.description: Pope Leo XIV has named Bishop Ronald Hicks of Joliet, Illinois, to succeed retiring Timothy Cardinal Dolan as archbishop of New York.

item.title: Nigeria apologises over Burkina Faso military flight that saw 11 servicemen detained
item.description: The air force personnel have been released but have not yet returned home, Nigeria says.

item.title: CBS News and The Free Press launch town hall and debate series
item.description: "Things That Matter," a series of planned town halls and debates sponsored by Bank of America, will launch early next year.

item.title: French 'Doctor Death' who poisoned patients jailed for life
item.description: A court finds Frédéric Péchier guilty of contaminating infusion bags with substances that caused cardiac arrest or hemorrhaging.

item.title: Bit by bit, small US groups chip away at historic levels of social isolation
How the DOJ’s assault charges against protesters are crumbling inside courtrooms
item.description: The Justice Department has embarked on a monthslong effort to prosecute people accused of assaulting federal officers during protests of President Don...

item.title: Trump Media to merge with fusion energy company TAE in $6 billion deal
item.description: President Trump's media company is joining forces with a company working to commercialize fusion energy.

item.title: Zelensky gives stark warning as EU leaders start crunch talks on Russia's frozen cash
item.description: The leaders are deciding whether to loan tens of billions of euros in frozen Russian assets to fund Ukraine's military and economic needs.

item.title: Thailand bombs near Cambodia's Poipet border crossing
item.description: The bombings come as renewed border clashes show no sign of letting up between the two countries.

item.title: China fumes as White House announces record $10B in arms sales to Taiwan
item.description: The Trump administration's announcement of plan to sell Taiwan a record $10 billion worth of weapons draws an angry response from China.

item.title: Pulitzer Prize-winning correspondent Peter Arnett, who reported on Vietnam and Gulf wars, has died
